result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa Sue Beechner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Falsely Present Noncontrolled Substance, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(4)(am)1a.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes:
Reimburse $100 drug buy money.
All other costs remitted.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample & no surcharge.

No possession or consumption of alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription medication without a valid prescription and unless approved by agent.
May not be in taverns or bars or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants and grocery stores.
No contact with confidential informant or any known drug users.

Any assessments and counseling as directed by agent.
Submit to random urine screenings at least once per month.
Full time employment or part time employment if enrolled in school.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
